Package Player

Class Character

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
Player.Character
public class Character
extends city.cs.engine.Walker
Create a new Character representing the body the player will have control over, extending a Walker type to remain upright throughout the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Character​(city.cs.engine.World world)
    Initialises objects for the main player body, setting their attributes at specific integer values when they first start playing the game

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void airEnemyLiveCount()
    Function to decrement lives every time the player interacts with a airEnemy
    void decrementLiveCount()
    Function to decrement lives every time the player interacts with a reaper body
    void decrementPowerUp()
    Function that will decrement the number of powerups the player has every time they collide with an enemy body in the game
    void demonLiveCount()
    Function to decrement lives every time the player interacts with a IceDemon body
    void fireballLiveCount()
    Function to decrement lives every time the player interacts with a fireball
    int getKeyCount()
    Function that access the number of keys the player collects during the course of the game
    int getLiveCount()
    Function that will return the number of lives the user has during the course of the game
    int getPowerUp()
    Function to return the number of powerups the player collects in the game
    void incrementKeyCount()
    Increments the value in the keyCount variable every time the player collects a key
    void incrementLiveCount()
    increment the live count every time the player interacts with a heart body
    void incrementPowerUp()
    Function that will increment the number of powerups every time the player interacts with a powerup body in the game
    void setKeyCount​(int count)
    Function that can be declared outside of the class to set the key count to a different integer value
    void setLiveCount​(int lives)
    Function that can be declared outside of the class to set the live count to a different integer value
    void setPowerUp​(int powers)
    Function that can be declared outside to set the number of powerups collected as the player progress, in conjunction with being altered when the user skips between levels

  • Constructor Details

    • Character

      public Character​(city.cs.engine.World world)
      Initialises objects for the main player body, setting their attributes at specific integer values when they first start playing the game
      Parameters:
      world - the game world that will be generated to enable the character's movement and interactions with different bodies

  • Method Details

    • getKeyCount

      public int getKeyCount()
      Function that access the number of keys the player collects during the course of the game
      Returns:
      integer value for the number of keys

    • setKeyCount

      public void setKeyCount​(int count)
      Function that can be declared outside of the class to set the key count to a different integer value
      Parameters:
      count - variable assigned to the keyCount variable

    • getLiveCount

      public int getLiveCount()
      Function that will return the number of lives the user has during the course of the game
      Returns:
      integer value for the number of lives

    • setLiveCount

      public void setLiveCount​(int lives)
      Function that can be declared outside of the class to set the live count to a different integer value
      Parameters:
      lives - variable assigned to the liveCount variable

    • incrementKeyCount

      public void incrementKeyCount()
      Increments the value in the keyCount variable every time the player collects a key

    • incrementLiveCount

    • getPowerUp

      public int getPowerUp()
      Function to return the number of powerups the player collects in the game
      Returns:
      integer value for the powerup count

    • setPowerUp

      public void setPowerUp​(int powers)
      Function that can be declared outside to set the number of powerups collected as the player progress, in conjunction with being altered when the user skips between levels
      Parameters:
      powers - integer value that assigns the number of powerups collected

    • incrementPowerUp

      public void incrementPowerUp()
      Function that will increment the number of powerups every time the player interacts with a powerup body in the game

    • decrementPowerUp

      public void decrementPowerUp()
      Function that will decrement the number of powerups the player has every time they collide with an enemy body in the game
